remarks: This lemma is used to prove that there is a function ` g ` as in the proof of [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 92 (at the top of page 92): this lemma proves that g(t) < ( j + 1 / 3 ) * ε.  Here ` E ` is used to represent ε in the paper.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
stoweidlem11.1 $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
stoweidlem11.2 $e |- ( ph -> t e. T ) $.
stoweidlem11.3 $e |- ( ph -> j e. ( 1 ... N ) ) $.
stoweidlem11.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( 0 ... N ) ) -> ( X ` i ) : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem11.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( 0 ... N ) ) -> ( ( X ` i ) ` t ) <_ 1 ) $.
stoweidlem11.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( j ... N ) ) -> ( ( X ` i ) ` t ) < ( E / N ) ) $.
stoweidlem11.7 $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR+ ) $.
stoweidlem11.8 $e |- ( ph -> E < ( 1 / 3 ) ) $.
stoweidlem11 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( t e. T |-> sum_ i e. ( 0 ... N ) ( E x. ( ( X ` i ) ` t ) ) ) ` t ) < ( ( j + ( 1 / 3 ) ) x. E ) ) $.
